info.title: TASS API
info.description:
### Change Log

| Group | Sub-Group | Endpoint | Breaking Change | Action | Description |
| :-- | :-- | :-- | :-- | :-- | :-- |
| Employee/HR | Notes | Employee Confidential Notes | No | GET | Added new return field to endpoint, **has_attachment**. This field indicates whether an attachment exists for a note. This will save round-tripping to the API just to check if attachments exist for a note. |
| Employee/HR | Notes | Employee Standard Notes | No | GET | Added new return field to endpoint, **has_attachment**. This field indicates whether an attachment exists for a note. This will save round-tripping to the API just to check if attachments exist for a note. |
| Employee/HR | Qualifications | Employee Qualifications | No | GET | Added new return field to endpoint, **has_attachment**. This field indicates whether an attachment exists for a qualification. This will save round-tripping to the API just to check if attachments exist for a qualification. |
| Students | Notes | Confidential Notes | No | GET | Added new return field to endpoint, **has_attachment**. This field indicates whether an attachment exists for a note. This will save round-tripping to the API just to check if attachments exist for a note. |
| Students | Notes | Standard Notes | No | GET | Added new return field to endpoint, **has_attachment**. This field indicates whether an attachment exists for a note. This will save round-tripping to the API just to check if attachments exist for a note. |
| Student Medical | Medical Conditions | Medical Conditions | No | GET | Added new return field to endpoint, **has_attachment**. This field indicates whether an attachment exists for a medical condition. This will save round-tripping to the API just to check if attachments exist for a medical condition. |
| Student Medical | Medical Conditions | Medical Conditions | No | GET | Added new return field to endpoint, **has_note**. This field indicates whether a note exists for a medical condition. This will save round-tripping to the API just to check if notes exist for a medical condition. |
| Student Medical | Immunisations | Immunisation Register | No | GET | Added new return field to endpoint, **has_attachment**. This field indicates whether an attachment exists for the immunisation register. This will save round-tripping to the API just to check if attachments exist for the immunisation register. |
| Student Medical | Medications | Medications | No | GET | Added new return field to endpoint, **has_attachment**. This field indicates whether an attachment exists for a Medications. This will save round-tripping to the API just to check if attachments exist for a medication. |
| Student Medical | Medications | Medications | No | GET | Added new return field to endpoint, **has_note**. This field indicates whether a note exists for a Medications. This will save round-tripping to the API just to check if notes exist for a medication. |
| Student Medical | Medications | Medications | No | GET | Added new return field to endpoint, **has_schedule**. This field indicates whether a schedule exists for a Medications. This will save round-tripping to the API just to check if schedules exist for a medication. |
| Students | Attendance | Student Attendance | No | GET | Fixed issue where usage of oData filter on absent_date was not filtering return data correctly. |
| Students | Information | Communication Rules | No | GET | Fixed issue where communication rule data was not being returned for any student. |

> - Student information such as boarder, house, year group, campus etc. are from when the absence was recorded, they are not current values. If this student information was not archived as at the absence date, then these values are not obtainable and will be returned as null.

- ##### **Endpoint Details**
    | Group | Sub-Group | Name | Permission |
    |:------|:----------|:-----|:-----------|
    | Students | Photos | Photo Changes | Read |
    
- ##### **OData Functionality**
    | Functions | | | | |
    |:------|:------|:------|:------|:------|
    | ❌ $select | ❌ $filter | ❌ $orderby | ❌ $top | ❌ $skip |
    
- ##### **Purpose**
    - Retrieves a list of students whose photos have been updated, returning only the most recent photo change per student.
    - This endpoint supports incremental synchronization through a change tracking mechanism.

- ##### **How It Works**
    - Initial Request (no change_key)
         - Call `GET /students/photo/changes`
         - Returns all students with photo updates, one record per student (the most recent photo change)
         - Response includes a `change_key` for subsequent requests

    - Incremental Sync (with change_key)
         - Call `GET /students/photo/changes?change_key={ previous_change_key }`
         - Returns only students whose photos were updated AFTER the provided change_key
         - Response includes a new `change_key` for the next request

- ##### **Use Cases**
    - *Full Sync:* Omit `change_key` to get all student photo changes
    - *Incremental Sync:* Use the `change_key` from the previous response to poll for new changes
    - *Photo Management:* Track which student photos need to be refreshed in external systems

parameters.name: change_key
parameters.description: Change key for filtering records from a specific point onwards.

- ##### **Endpoint Details**  
     | Group | Sub-Group | Name | Permission |
     |:------|:----------|:-----|:-----------|

 - ##### **OData Functionality**
     | Functions | | | | |
     |:------|:------|:------|:------|:------|
     | ❌ $select | ❌ $filter | ❌ $orderby | ❌ $top | ❌ $skip |
     
 - ##### **Comments**
     - This endpoint returns a ZIP file containing both the student's photo and thumbnail.
     - A DIGEST header will be returned with the response. This will contain the SHA-256 hash of the file content. The value in the header is base64 encoded and will need to be decoded before checking against the file content.

get.summary: Accounts - Options - Account Code Format Rules
get.description:
- ##### **Endpoint Details**  
    | Group | Sub-Group | Name | Permission |
    |:------|:----------|:-----|:-----------|
    | General Ledger | Accounts | Accounts | Read / Add / Update |
    
- ##### **OData Functionality**
    | Functions | | | | |
    |:------|:------|:------|:------|:------|
    | ❌ $select | ❌ $filter | ❌ $orderby | ❌ $top | ❌ $skip |
    
- ##### **Account Code Explanation**
    - Each school can configure their own account code structure.
    - The account code can be made up of multiple parts, which then form the entire account code. Each part has a defined starting position, length and type.
    - The types are as follows:
        - `S` - Segment - This part of the account code must match one of the valid values defined in the segments list.
        - `F` - Filler - This part of the account code must match exactly the default_text value.
        - `C` - Custom - This part of the account code can be anything as long as it meets maximum length requirements.

    | Group | Sub-Group | Name | Permission |

- ##### **Endpoint Details**
    | Group | Sub-Group | Name | Permission |
    |:------|:----------|:-----|:-----------|
    | Employee/HR | Photos | Photo Changes | Read |
    
- ##### **OData Functionality**
    | Functions | | | | |
    |:------|:------|:------|:------|:------|
    | ❌ $select | ❌ $filter | ❌ $orderby | ❌ $top | ❌ $skip |
    
- ##### **Purpose**
    - Retrieves a list of employees whose photos have been updated, returning only the most recent photo change per employee.
    - This endpoint supports incremental synchronization through a change tracking mechanism.

- ##### **How It Works**
    - Initial Request (no change_key)
         - Call `GET /employees/photo/changes`
         - Returns all employees with photo updates, one record per employee (the most recent photo change)
         - Response includes a `change_key` for subsequent requests

    - Incremental Sync (with change_key)
         - Call `GET /employees/photo/changes?change_key={ previous_change_key }`
         - Returns only employees whose photos were updated AFTER the provided change_key
         - Response includes a new `change_key` for the next request

- ##### **Use Cases**
    - *Full Sync:* Omit `change_key` to get all employee photo changes
    - *Incremental Sync:* Use the `change_key` from the previous response to poll for new changes
    - *Photo Management:* Track which employee photos need to be refreshed in external systems

parameters.name: change_key
parameters.description: Change key for filtering records from a specific point onwards.

- ##### **Endpoint Details**

- ##### **Comments**
    - This endpoint returns a ZIP file containing both the employee's photo and thumbnail.
    - A DIGEST header will be returned with the response. This will contain the SHA-256 hash of the file content. The value in the header is base64 encoded and will need to be decoded before checking against the file content.
